summary: This is an email chain regarding the case US v. Maxwell (20cr330). It forwards a notification from Judge Nathan's chambers granting the parties additional time for supplemental briefing, specifically for CC statements and Exhibit 52. The sender expresses relief at the extension.

persons.name: Nathan
persons.context: Referred to in the context of 'Judge Nathan' whose chambers granted an extension for supplemental briefing in the case US v. Maxwell.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Appears as a recipient of the email from Nathan NYSD Chambers regarding the court order in US v. Maxwell.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Appears as a recipient of the email from Nathan NYSD Chambers regarding the court order in US v. Maxwell, identified with USANYS.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: Identified as the Honorable Judge whose chambers issued the order granting additional time for supplemental briefing in US v. Maxwell.

connections.description: Judge Nathan's chambers communicated a court order extension to counsel Pagliuca in the case US v. Maxwell.
Judge Nathan's chambers communicated a court order extension to counsel Menninger in the case US v. Maxwell.
Both are listed as counsel recipients of the same court order communication in the case US v. Maxwell.

events.title: Court grants extension for supplemental briefing
events.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan granted the parties additional time to file two sets of supplemental briefing, specifically CC statements and Exhibit 52, in the case US v. Maxwell.

keyFacts: Judge Alison J. Nathan granted an extension for supplemental briefing in the criminal case US v. Maxwell (20cr330).
The extension specifically concerned CC statements and Exhibit 52, with a deadline set for the upcoming Friday.
The communication originated from Judge Nathan's chambers and was directed to counsel Jeff Pagliuca and Laura Menninger.
The email sender expressed significant personal relief ('I can finally sleep!') upon receiving the extension notification.
